intro: Heliocarpus nodiflorus, commonly known as the clustered heliocarpus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by hard, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
